Best Printers for Event Rentals

June 26, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Why Printer Rentals Matter at Events

Events run on informationâ€”signage, ID cards, brochures, certificates, and more. If your on-site printing fails or underperforms, it can lead to long lines, frustrated attendees, and lost credibility.

Thatâ€™s why having the right printer rental for your event is critical. Renting the right model ensures:

  • Reliable high-volume printing

  • Fast print speed to minimize queues

  • Mobility, if needed on-site

  • Compatibility with your teamâ€™s tech setup
    ðŸ‘‰ Learn more here: Planning Printer Rentals for Events

Top Features to Look For in Event Printers

When choosing the best printers for event rentals, look beyond just price. Focus on functionality:

1. High Volume Capacity

Events often require printing hundreds or even thousands of pages. Look for printers with large input trays and high monthly duty cycles.
ðŸ‘‰ Explore more: High-Volume Printers for Event Needs

2. Fast Print Speed

Speed matters. Choose models with at least 20â€“40 pages per minute (ppm) to avoid backups at check-in counters.

3. Portability and Setup

In dynamic event environments, compact and easy-to-set-up printers are ideal. Consider wireless or portable units if space is tight.
ðŸ‘‰ Check options: Portable Printers for Events

4. Connectivity

Ensure the printer supports:

  • USB and Ethernet

  • Wireless printing

  • Mobile printing (AirPrint, Google Cloud Print)

Categories of Printers for Events

Different events call for different printing needs. Here's a breakdown of the best options by category.

1. All-in-One Laser Printers

Great for medium to large events that require not just printing but also scanning and copying. All-in-one models are ideal for:

  • Registration booths

  • Back offices for document prep

  • Emergency reprints of event materials

Recommended Models:

  • HP LaserJet Pro M428fdw

  • Brother MFC-L8900CDW

2. Compact Portable Printers

Perfect for on-the-go printing, such as:

  • Mobile event check-ins

  • Printing tickets or name badges on-demand

  • Pop-up booths

Recommended Models:

  • Canon PIXMA TR150 (wireless, inkjet)

  • Epson WorkForce WF-110 (portable, battery-powered)

3. High-Speed Monochrome Laser Printers

If your event involves a lot of black-and-white document printing, these are efficient and budget-friendly.

Recommended Models:

  • Brother HL-L6200DW

  • Lexmark MS821dn

4. Color Laser Printers

Use these if you need professional-quality flyers, certificates, or branded documents on-site.

Recommended Models:

  • HP Color LaserJet Enterprise M555dn

  • Xerox VersaLink C400

5. Label and ID Badge Printers

If your event includes check-in kiosks or requires printing labels or ID badges, label printers are a must.

Recommended Models:

  • Zebra ZD420

  • Brother QL-820NWB

How to Choose the Best Printer for Your Event

Choosing the best printer for event rentals depends on a few practical questions:

  • How many pages do you expect to print?

  • Will the printer be in a fixed location or mobile?

  • Do you need color or monochrome output?

  • Is fast setup important?

  • Whatâ€™s your available space and power source?

ðŸ‘‰ For help estimating the total cost:
Cost of Printer Rentals for Events

Tips for Renting the Right Printer

Here are a few tips to make sure your rental experience is smooth:

1. Book Early

The best models get booked quicklyâ€”especially during peak event seasons.

2. Check for Technical Support

Make sure the rental comes with onsite or on-call technical support in case of issues.

3. Request a Backup Plan

Ask the rental company if they provide backup units or fast replacements.

4. Understand the Pricing

Some rentals charge based on:

  • Duration (daily, weekly)

  • Print volume (per page)

  • Service calls

Always clarify the full pricing structure.

Common Mistakes to Avoid

  • Renting a slow printer â€“ Slows down event operations.

  • Not testing before the event â€“ Always do a test print!

  • Forgetting power supply needs â€“ Some portable printers require AC adapters or battery packs.

  • Overlooking service contracts â€“ Ensure tech support is included.

Why Renting Is Smarter Than Buying for Events

Buying a printer for a one-time or occasional event doesnâ€™t make financial senseâ€”especially when you consider:

  • Storage and transport costs

  • Maintenance

  • Obsolescence over time

Renting gives you access to newer models, better features, and lower upfront costsâ€”all without the long-term responsibility.
ðŸ‘‰ Check the best models available: Best Printers for Event Rentals

Conclusion: Choose the Right Tool for the Job

The best printers for event rentals are those that meet your specific needsâ€”whether it's volume, speed, portability, or high-quality output. With the right printer, you can streamline check-ins, impress guests with professional materials, and handle unexpected printing needs like a pro.

Before your next event, take time to plan your printing solution. Choosing the right rental printer might seem like a small task, but it can make a big difference in the success and flow of your event.
